newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: LG Semicon to raise non-memory sales.
newsitem.headline: LG Semicon to raise non-memory sales.

text.p: LG Semicon Co, a unit of South Korea's LG Group, said on Tuesday it planned to raise its non-memory chip sales in the domestic market to 50 percent of its total local sales by the year 2000 from 32 percent in 1996.
LG Semicon's domestic semiconductor sales totalled 220 billion won in 1996, with 70 billion won coming from non-memory chips, the company said in a statement.
The company said its domestic semiconductor sales would reach one trillion won in the year 2000, about 10 percent of its total target sales, including exports.
In 1996, LG Semicon's semiconductor sales totalled 2.1 trillion won, of which 90 percent came from exports.

To strengthen the non-memory sector, LG Semicon signed strategic alliances with seven specialist firms in the fields of application specific integrated circuits (ASIC) and micro components, the company said.
The ASIC specialist companies include Core System Co, Yujin Technology and MITECH in micro control unit and I & C Technology and Simon Co, it said.
